lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Perhaps I can introduce them to you now. Over here is cabbage-smelling Brian Foster. Next to him is the fabulously talented and sultry Mary Elizabeth McGlynn. Next to her is cute-as-a-button Ashly Burch. Then my wife and yours, Liam O'Brien. Next to him, playing his first ever game of Dungeons and Dragons--

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I just got off my Uber shift, and I am terrified right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He really doesn't know how to play at all, and didn't really practice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He knows six percent less than you!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's right! I will be asking for a lot of help tonight from Liam O'Brien, as will Eric.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I'll turn to the right and ask Matt-- he's not here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt and Marisha and the rest of the Critical Role gang are on the playa in Burning Man right now, so they can't be here. Naked. Humping each other. So they can't be here tonight, but we're going to carry on without them and have a one-shot deal. We have some announcements before we go, right, Liam?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I got some, you got some.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll start. First, new merch, guys! New merch available in the store right now. This awesome shirt that says Dalen's Closet in Shamal Bay. It's a little throwback to that little fun beach adventure we had with pranks and stuff. Ooh, it's so soft.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you think that sleeves are bullshit, we have this one, as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, that's such a beachy shirt!

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: You get a great tan with that shirt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, I love it! And it's available in the store already? Now? Go purchase it! Go purchase the shirts.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I want to see Travis wear that when he works out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's more stuff, though. Well, the Dagger Dagger Dagger shirt is back. I know that's not brand new, but it's new-ish. The Scanlan shirt is even less new-ish, but it's an amazing shirt, and it's still there. We have the aprons still, we have pencils, we have Tarot cards. I feel like going: ooh. She's in the desert; she can't touch me right now. That's it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So that's our merch update. Liam and I will be tomorrow morning flying to Sacramento to do SacAnime. Are you doing it, Mary?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Steve Blum there. I haven't met, I'm looking forward to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we'll be in Sacramento for the weekend, me and Liam, doing stuff. Come see us. Come say hi if you're in the northern central California vicinity. Sure. Any other announcements, Liam?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we've got that art book coming out. If you want to get updates you can go over to geekandsundry.com/artbook and sign up for updates, and you'll get the latest. And then also, Taliesin's not here; he's also naked in the desert, but on Wednesday he'll be back for Wednesday Club. In addition to everything they're going to be talking about, there will be a little scuttlebutt about the Critical Role comic book. We might show you the cover of the damn thing. Other things to announce about it, so tune in if you're curious.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: There's Talks Machina Tuesday night.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh Jesus, Brian, come on.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I'll talk to you guys afterward about who's going to be on, and then we'll announce. So that's it, 7:00 on these very channels.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eric, anything to plug?

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: DuckTales. That's how we do our thing. We're on DuckTales together.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, he plays many characters.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Yes, actually, I think the 23rd may be the introduction of the many characters.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh is that true? September 23rd, tune in to DuckTales. He played 30 characters in one episode? Something like that. It's a lot.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I had to sing Happy Birthday 47 times. 47 different accents.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ash-boo, anything?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think you're great and you're going to do a great job. Oh, OK K.O.!, which Mary's also on, is out now on Cartoon Network. Are you on it, Bauza?

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I'm just trying to learn how to play tonight. This is my guy. It's almost like it's the same person.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hi guys! Welcome back!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: He got in just under the wire.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Safe. Totally safe.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: How many drinks do you have going there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have two drinks, one alcoholic--

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: And one if that one breaks down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. So needless to say, I'm super nervous because I've never done this before, but it's going to be fun, and if it sucks then who cares, right? So let's just dive in, right? I'm going to play music from my iPad.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Thank you for telling us everything you're doing as you do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm now turning to my notes. All right. I'm about to begin the show.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: This is great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With the lack of clothing comes an oversupply of skin, skin of all shades and body parts. The ruddy belly of a human salesman stuffing himself on rotten mutton. The dark blue-tinted shoulder of a tiefling whore, enticing a gray, bearded, older man upstairs. The gray forearm of a half-orc merchant, drawing a mug of Greep from the keg on the bar. Greep, by the way, is a homemade house liqueur. It's so potent, its nickname is "kindling" because it is also extremely flammable. Hint, hint, hint!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Red barrels, everywhere!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Val, the bartender, approaches. "Hi. So what can I get you?"

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What is your name?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Well, no." I have a menu.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm over-prepared. Oh god, I've lost the menu. Oh god, everything's gone wrong one minute into the show. Oh god. "We have ale."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Any Fireball?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "We have Greep, which is the house liqueur. We have some whiskey, and we have some wine. The wine "is not very good."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'll have the whiskey. Actually, you know what? Can I have whiskey with a Greep chaser, please?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Oh, sure. That'll be seven copper."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right, here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "There you go. What brings you around here? Haven't seen you before."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I've been looking for a girl, and there was a man who told me of this place.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Well, we have two ladies of the night over there. One is named Zarvah; she's the tiefling, "and she's a crowd pleaser. Yes. The other is Kay, and she's over there as well."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Thank you, thank you. Actually, I was looking for someone a bit younger than both of them. She has red hair. I'm wondering if you've seen anyone quite like that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "I'm no one to judge but whatever sort of thing floats your boat. I don't know any young "whores, if that's what you're asking for."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, just a young girl. All right. Frankfurt, have you heard of a man named Frankfurt?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Sure, yes. Frankfurt. He's a dwarven man. He comes in here from time to time. I think he's on a "run. I haven't seen him tonight."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. Well, he told me to come here, so I did. So I'll just have a drink for now, if that's all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "All right, I'll let you know if he arrives."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Thank you so much, I do appreciate that, Val.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just then, a tall female humanoid with rippling biceps and long whiskers takes the next stool over. She's covered with tan and orange fur, which is unsurprising because she is tabaxi, a cat-woman. Her feline face is bandaged from recent battles, and she snarls with an imposing posture that says, "Don't fuck with me." This is Clothesline. Val approaches. "Oh, hey, "Clothesline. The usual, I assume?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you have the milk that I ordered?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Yes." Val takes out a saucer of warm milk and puts it on the bar. "Oh, and here's some "spice, too." She places a box of crimson powder on the bar. It is catnip.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thanks, Val.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "What happened to your face?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, you know. It's a funny story. I clotheslined some people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Oh, that's--"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Generally when you clothesline someone you (clicks tongue) go, but they caught on for a little bit, went for a little bit of a ride, and then I killed them. So that's that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Wow. That sounds like a lovely evening?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh yeah, it was great! I could've done without all the cleanup after. There was a lot of blood. It's hard to get out of the old fur.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Sure. Clothesline, this is-- What was your name again?"

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Gryffin. Gryffin Erendel.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Hello, how are you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You got weird eyes. What's the deal with her eyes?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: They're gold. There's nothing wrong with them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They're gold, like currency gold?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, they're not karated gold, they're just gold. I'm a sunny Eladrin half-elf, all right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What does that mean?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "I don't know. I don't really know."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's who you are. So cheers to us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't cheers ladies with weird eyes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. You've got a little blood on you there, dear.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Strolling over to the table, with a wobbly gait, is a short elven man with gray skin, gray hair, and a black leather choker. He wears a sour expression and projects abject apathy. He reeks of booze and appears to be wearing dark red eye makeup. This is Kingston, and it looks like Kingston is approaching Jayne.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Evening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, hello.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Do you come here a lot?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. I am traveling, actually.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Alone?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: By what mode of transportation are you traveling?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's start with my childhood.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Great! Do you want a drink?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, and that was irony. I could have something to eat. Do you want to get us something to eat?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yeah. Any dietary restrictions? I don't want to walk over and then have to come back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a little something.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Okay. I'll walk over to Val. Unless there's table service?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hell no. "Hi, Kingston. What can I get for you?"

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Me and the child over there need food.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "The child?"

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: She's a bit young for me. I like them old.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "You're going to buy this person food?"

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "With what money?"

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: You can put it on my fucking tab, for starters. She looks famished. She's traveled by some unknown mode of transportation. She looks famished. She doesn't want a drink. She wants to eat. Put it on my tab. Consider it a humanitarian gift.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "All right, I'll give you some bread. All right?"

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: And also some Greep for me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Fine." Takes a glass of Greep for you. "And here's two loaves of bread. On your tab. Again."

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Thank you. I walk over and hand her the loaves. Here you go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's nice.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I get stuff free around here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're from here?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yeah. Nearby.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it always this cold?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Well, not in here. But outside? Yeah, it's pretty cold.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, what was your name?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Kingston LaForge.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Strong name.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Thank you. I come from a long line of LaForges.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tell me about yourself. And as he goes, she starts inspecting the room, kind of listening.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, you see a bunch of rowdy people all about you. No one out of the ordinary that you can see so far. Let's see here, what interesting things? You know what? Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was almost good. Ten.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You see lots of festive people eating lots of food and drinking lots of wine. That's about it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does anybody look dangerous?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's got his sword sheathed, and he looks like he could do some damage, maybe. That's about it. The prostitutes look really feisty, and one of them is having an argument, still, with this man, about payment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you were going to tell me your story?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Did you see that cat lady over there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I did.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: She is something else. I'm not saying I have a type, but my preferred terrain is a litter box.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, I'm happy to share the loaves of bread with you, but my feelings won't be hurt if you want to change over.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Thank you, but I'll tell you a little bit about myself first. What would you like to know?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, start from the beginning. You grew up here? Tell me all about it.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I was born Kingston LaForge. Still am. To a long line of LaForges.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Did you hear him say Kingston LaForge?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: My family was acrobats.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why is she talking to me, Val?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Carnies. 24/7 locksmiths. I, however, was afraid of heights, so I had to learn how to sing for my supper. However, nature took over around the age of teen. I lost my beautiful singing voice. It was a falsetto, a very lovely falsetto.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When you were young, you lost it? That must have been a long time ago.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh yes, over 100 years. So I left my family and the traveling circus, and I found myself a wife, Cloris. We wed, and together, I wrote some of the best books the land has ever seen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jayne is quietly digging her fingernails into her leg to stop from screaming.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I quietly start pounding on the bar.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Together, we bore a child, and it was one of the most incredible things that ever happened to me. The child was precious.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh my god, Kingston, give it a rest!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Hi!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I was just talking to this child--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I get it. It's creepy. Could you stop creeping us all out? You re-hash your goddamn life story every time you come in here.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: She asked me a question. I have an interesting story.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You don't have an interesting-- No! Your beautiful falsetto? No! No one cares!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: You say that because you never got to hear it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Hello, I'm sorry, my name is Gryffin Erendel and I'm the biggest fan. I can't begin to tell you how much I love your work. Your book of poetry, Black and White, was one of the most amazing things I've ever read in my entire life and I happen to have a copy with me. Would you please sign it? Do you mind? I don't want to intrude. I would pay for it.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Have you read some of my other books?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes, I have!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Two Witches, One Broom?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes, yes! The Wicked Grouse?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yes, Doors: The Idiot's Enemy?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Val, another milk, please!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Here you go. Here's your book.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "I made it a double."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You have no idea. Would you read from it?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I will, after. May I talk to you for a minute? I know, may I just-- (sighs) I know we don't get along very often. However, I find you to be very attractive.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, what the hell, Kingston!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I've struggled on how to say this to you, but--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You are this close from a claw in your goddamn eye, Kingston. So choose the next few words carefully.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Catnip and chill?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I attack Kingston?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure! Whatever you want to do.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I step back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I try to punch Kingston in the mouth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, roll for an attack.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, let's see. I don't want to use my claws. I guess I'm going to clothesline him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great. Clothesline attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Roll a d20, add, what is it, five?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, what's your armor class there, Kingston?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: My armor? 13.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a hit, right, Liam? 13 and 13, that's a hit? All right, roll for damage. 1d4 plus something.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Eight!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow! Did you roll a four? Okay, so you don't have to roll for anything.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Hold on, I'm buried in my notes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So Clothesline has a special clothesline attack. If she rolls a four, it's eight points of damage to you, sir, and you are knocked prone.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Shit, that's amazing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a big fucking hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It is! I deliberately didn't use my claws because I didn't want to hurt you too much!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So Kingston slams down onto the floor, taking a couple of drinks with him. He's dazed. He's woozy. He looks around. He didn't even see it coming.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Did my drink go with me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, yeah. Greep all over the floor. All over you. You now have a flammable alcohol all over you. It's probably stinging your eyes. You hardly know who hit you or why.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I'm blinded!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: He will write of this day, and I will know that I was here!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: You're going to have to write this down. I can't see!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's all in my mind!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Xavier, the manager, comes over. "All right, enough of that! No fights tonight, all right?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry, Xave, sorry.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: It was just foreplay. We have a big night planned, and I'm sorry we started it in your establishment.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No fights? What about a murder? One murder?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Nothing like that tonight, please."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I use Prestidigitation to cleanse him off.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What did you just do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone in the bar turns to see and goes like this to you when you do it. You are no longer flammable.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What the hell was that? What you just did? Creepy guy? He's no longer whatever?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What, you've never heard of magic?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know about magic.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, you do? Well then, why are you asking me such a silly question?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Val, I'm going to move to a table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Sure."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I meant no offense.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As the tabaxi glides across the room, finding another table, let's move you over here. I just knocked over a stool.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I'm going to walk back over to Jayne. Yeah, because things didn't go as well as I was hoping.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They walk in, and let's put them here for now. One dwarf is sullen, with thick muttonchops and a stumpy axe. He says, "I tire of the road. We eat here and rest. Frankfurt, this is your job. You pay. Obby "the Rat is done for the day."

lines.name: ASHLEY, LIAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The other dwarf is a younger, stronger man with a braided beard, piercing eyes, and a heavy maul in his hand. He scans the room and picks a table. Unlike some of the patrons, these two do not check their weapons. Instead, they park them under the table. This is Frankfurt and his friend, Obby the Rat. They pull up a chair for the young, fair-skinned ginger girl, who joins them. Her eyes sparkle with innocence and a touch of fear. Her name, we will learn, is Holly. "You have been to "this place before?"

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Yep, many times. Known for their Greep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "What is that?"

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Delicious, is what it is. You should try some.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Obby the Rat drinks ale."

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Careful, there's a cat-woman in here. You might want to be careful of that. Val! Two Greeps, please!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Yes, right away, Frankfurt! That's him."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Thank you so much.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Certainly. Tips would be appreciated."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, of course! What was I thinking? Here. I give her a piece of gold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Oh, wow. Thank you very much."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I start taking off my clothes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "All of your clothes?"

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Almost all. It's hot. It's boiling in here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "It is very hot. Are you sure you want to strip down? There are unsavory types in here."

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I'm a regular. They've seen the merchandise before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: We've got some cargo here that people might be interested in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "What cargo? We are not transporting any cargo tonight."

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Well, not anything in particular that anyone would be looking for, but have you seen Garello around?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "I do not know this Garello. You have spoken of him, but I don't know that I would recognize him."

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Well, keep your eyes peeled.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Perhaps ask someone else."

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Hey, Cat-Woman?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, for fuck's sake, what?

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: How are you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How do I look?

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Bloody! And your glass is half empty. Val! More milk, please!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Right away. Whole or skim this time?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Give me the raw shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: So! How's your night been?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I've had better.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Okay. Any scraps you've been into?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What do you want, man?

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Okay, look. I'm going to get down to business here. I've got this girl, and we're looking for a guy named Garello. Maybe you've heard of him?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Garello?

lines.name: ERIC

So hot, in fact, that you all get the sense that if you don't remove an article of clothing soon, you may become exhausted. So there's a brief pause in the action where everyone says, "Oh my "god. lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay! Suddenly, without warning, without making a sound, a new mysterious figure emerges from the back room. Pushing Xavier away, he moves quickly and silently across the Ass Sailor with a speed none of you have ever witnessed. It's like the figure runs without moving his body. He floats in a beautiful sprint. As he passes by you, Gryffin, you suddenly feel even hotter than before. For an instant, he strikes fear into your heart. Roll a perception check.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (gasps) Perception. That would be a 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And as he whizzes by you, past these sleeping people, you see the faintest flick of a tail. He runs across. Does not say a word. Does not make an attack towards you, Frankfurt. Does not even regard you. But simply removes Holly from your grasp. Roll a strength save.

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: SAM

He does wrest Holly from your grasp, but you slow him down considerably and he only gets five more feet away from you. He's going this way.

lines.text: That is Gryffin's turn. Next is-- I don't care about them. Jayne. Oh, sorry. There is a ranger who's going to shoot somebody. I don't care. I'm rolling to see who she fires at, and I rolled Jayne. Sorry, I rolled randomly. It's a plus-five, so that's eight plus five, 13.

lines.text: Okay, so I know that I can get within ten feet. I'm going to take my fucking white whip and whip this guy in the fucking face.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.text: Oh, then neither worked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, you see a blue spectral hand reach out towards your face. It's super freaky. There's fingernails on it, and then it suddenly (gasp) faces away. It's super weird, and it emerges from Jayne. While she cast the spell, it seems that her lips go to the back a little bit, then become thinner. Her eyes narrow, and she has this skeleton look for half a second as she casts the spell and then goes back to normal.

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 18 points of damage. Oh shit.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Take that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa. My god. The man with the girl is super surprised. Oh wait. Even though you hit him with this insanely hard hit-- you connected real hard-- somehow, he shrugs it off and turns to you and sneers at you. He does take some damage, but it doesn't seem like it's as much as you thought it would be.

lines.text: He just touched him. The trapdoor is open, and he is gone, and that's where we'll take our break.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fuck that guy!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering and applause)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: BRIAN

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: Congratulations and meow.

lines.text: CholieAmenthys?

lines.text: So guys, when last we left, a mysterious figure, who emanated heat, had grabbed Holly, the little girl, who Frankfurt and Obby-- oh, we need music-- were transporting, tore across the bar, and went down into this trapdoor. You are all confused, looking around; there's still fights going on. What would you like to do? Go.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MARY

lines.text: Oh shit. Okay, you get to the top of the open trapdoor, and look down into darkness.

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, yeah. Many of you have darkvision. It's okay, guys.

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.name: BRIAN

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On your other side, Sam.

lines.text: Oh, there they are. Let's place you guys around somewhere, haphazardly. Oh god, this thing's so far. I can't do it.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.name: SAM, BRIAN
lines.text: (singing) To your heart.

lines.name: ERIC

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: What happened to your necklace? Wait, I couldn't talk to him, I'm falling down a tunnel with my ass made of light.

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: BRIAN

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: BRIAN

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk past the idiot and start walking down the hallway.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Piece of shit. I cast Talk to Me at Once!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could pull it towards me. It's going to wreck some microphones over there. Okay. I should tell you, before you start walking, at the foot of the stairs there's a single lantern casting a dim glow, although that doesn't matter because you've got Light coming out of your ass. On the walls are graffiti, seemingly from patrons who've wandered down here. One reads, "For a good time, do not "call Isabelle." Another reads, "Do you know why they call him Obby the Rat? Because his dick is "the size of a rodent." And the other one says, "What do you call a pile of tabaxi? A Meowntain."

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Respect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Straight on at the bottom of the steps, a narrow corridor leading out around a slight bend, obscuring the view. To the other direction, it's a dead wall, however there is a space underneath the back of the stairway. It is dank and cold. Light frost covers the floor, because you are out of that hot bar, now. So you would like to continue down this hall?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm looking as carefully as I can into the next space. I will peer for enemies or the people we're following or anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It ends with a simple wooden door and a rusty knob. Are you still in the same marching order? Kingston first or Kingston second?

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's not. Clothesline, get up here.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I'm ass flicker.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck you! I don't follow your orders. You tried to kill me!

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Okay. It empties out into a wider room, and I'm going to do this. All right, so what would you like to do?

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten? That's what you needed. So there is frost everywhere. It's super cold down here, because we're underground in a cellar area, and it's winter. Yeah, now you're also getting cold.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I don't have a fucking shirt on!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Your nipples are rock-hard.

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: MARY

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, there's a fucking snake on the left! Oops, a fucking snake just bit me. I take one point damage and I make a constitution save versus ten.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Constitution, which, okay. Ten.

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: MARY

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes. Another fucking snake. Whoa! I will take that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Do you proceed into this room or do you hang out?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I turn around and I say: kitty-kitty, there seems to be another room down here and it seems to me that the frost is dissipating a bit on the floor. What do you think we should do? There's no sign of footprints, but I don't know that there were footprints on the other way. Jayne, do you see footprints? Besides your own, of course.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm looking at the door in front of me and seeing if I can see anything hinky with it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The door is not locked and not trapped.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I'm going to go inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In the center of the room, a wooden table resembling a crude chemistry lab. Beakers and vials are arranged. A whiff of something strange hits you. It stings your nose like gasoline. Would you like to look around?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would first like to cast Light again, because it's a cantrip, I can do it as many times as I want, and that means the bard's ass goes out and I'll say that the grip of my whip lights up and I hold it upside down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's so cool. So you've got a white whip that's lit up.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So it's finally useful, is it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're not there.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That was Zahra showing up for a moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You said there were potions on the table that I see now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can investigate that, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is it possible for me at some point to try to grapple her?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To grapple Jayne? If you want to walk down the hall, you can try.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've entered the room and I want to inspect the potions you said there were on the table?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, roll an investigation check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I move toward the room?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And try to grapple Jayne?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, ten is what you needed. Upon further inspection, you use your light to reveal the labels on the jugs. Someone has been mixing liquor down here. After a minute of study, you figure out that the house alcohol, Greep, is made right here, and the formula is remarkably basic. It is four parts standard rice wine, one part balsamic vinegar, one part simple syrup, and one part pure kerosene. Everyone who has drank it has been drinking kerosene the whole night.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I jot that down on a scrap of paper and put it away, because I am a businesswoman, as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's it. That's all you find, currently.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I will start back and find the catwoman in the doorway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Catwoman, what would you like to do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hi, Jayne. And I would like to grapple her by the neck and hold her aloft.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh hi, Jayne.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How's Sanctuary going? Still on?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's up to you. If ten minutes have passed since I cast it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It has not been ten minutes. So you'll have to make a wisdom saving throw against 14.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shit. Well, she's not very smart so she would try. Natural 20.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's the third one for Burch!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So sadly, that does not mean that you grapple. That means that you have the fortitude to attempt to grapple.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It'd be really sad if it fails right now. I got a nine. Is there anything I could apply to it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, strength, and you're pretty strong.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So it's 12.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, three? Your strength is three? No, it's not.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Plus three modifier?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Really? I thought you were stronger than that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, or is it this one? Saving throw?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, you're right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I have to roll versus it. So you got a what total?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I'm still so used to Liam rolling and then going: 196.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The big thing tonight is I'm like: luck-- no. Phantom limb syndrome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, so you are grappled and restrained. You both can't move or anything, unless you want to try to drag her somewhere.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I want to be like: what the fuck, man? You brought me here. I'm doing you a favor. Why did you try to fucking kill me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (strained) It was probably a bad idea.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Bad idea, yeah. So? How are you going to make it up to me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (strained) I think you need to kill me later. I think we need to survive this basement.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't give a fuck about this girl or anything going on with you, so if you don't want to die right now, or have me leave and fucking feed you to these dogs--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're talking a long time. Can I cast a spell?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to cast Inflict Wounds at second level. Make a melee spell attack against a creature you reach. Okay. She's done. That is a 19 plus six. That is a 25.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does this spell do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is Inflict Wounds. Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 necrotic damage. Except I'm doing it at second level, so it's 4d10. And so my hand just grips her forearm and death filters through it. Ten. 19. 29.

lines.name: ASHLEY, MARY
lines.text: (singing) I have three hit points, just three hit points. I am about to die.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was beautiful. And sad.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not even the bard.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You know what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, so you are released, Jayne, from her grapple.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Whatever you want to do is fine. That was fine. Everything is fine. What do you need, buddy?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Can I do something? Since we're all in the same area. Am I standing next to Frankfurt?

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Ah, Jesus! It's freezing down here.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have two hit points left! I'm bad at math. I have two hit points left. So am I knocked out?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, you're awake, you motherfucker!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You are feeling really shitty right now.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Wait! Did she do the 1d6 to her attack for the bardic inspiration that I gave you?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: She hasn't used it yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's water under the bridge, Brain.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Fuck the bridge!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Use it next time for something!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Okay. Can I force myself to throw up Greep onto him? It says I have a candle, can I then light that candle and light Frankfurt on fire because I threw Greep up on to him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, you can certainly make an attempt.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That's 3,000 actions.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gagging your ass and then lighting a candle seems like possibly three actions.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Have you ever had someone with a gnome bard-sized penis steal your wife from you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So many times. Go ahead and make a constitution saving throw to see if you can make yourself throw up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: DND is all about negotiation.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Constitution saving. We're going to go with a 12-- or no, 11.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You stick your fingers down your throat to throw up, but it doesn't work. You gag and dry heave for a while, and nothing comes up, unfortunately.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: So a typical night at the tavern.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right, you two, would you stop it for the moment? Seriously. We have a mission here, or at least you and I have a mission and I do not want to-- Look, Kingston, I love your work, I really do and I realize that you're a fantastic writer and everything else, but there are other things to do right now. There is a room underneath the stairs. Shall we check it out? It gets increasingly warmer, it seems.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Are the elderly whores in there?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes! They most certainly are.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (whispering) Frankfurt, come with me and we'll get to her. Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who's going down there? You three?

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: The others split up and go rogue. Whoa!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That this tunnel continues into darkness for a wide oval anteroom. It's a bit oddly shaped to be a storage room; it's about 20 feet wide with a 15 foot coved ceiling.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: My ass is an hour?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When he cast Light, it went out.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh. Can I cast Light?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, if you would like to? Okay. Things look nice and bright in here. Four evenly spaced pillars are holding up the ceiling, each with intricate, beautiful carvings. At the other side of the room is a single large door. The door seems to be made of heavy forged iron, with carefully inlaid bronze details: images of fire and lizard tongues. Who would like to do anything or walk around or enter? What do you want to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While they're thinking about it, can I talk to the cat?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, go ahead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not a very nice person.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (strained) I'm gathering that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. I am a servant of the Chained Oblivion, and I want

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sure, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or you could come with me and help me get this girl. And then maybe you'll make your way out of it. Maybe you'll survive. I'm going to give you a chance because I think you're worth more to me alive now than dead. And if you're very nice and don't argue, I'll even make you feel a little better. What do you say?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're good. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Clothesline, I'm not a nice person.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I get it! I got it from the time when you almost killed me, yeah. I got it. I'm good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I facepalm her and cast Cure Wounds. That is-- I'll tell you. That is eight hit points back for you. Hooray, eight, hey!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, ugh. (coughs) I would say thanks, but I'm not going to argue. What do you need?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can try to kill me later. I want the little red-haired girl, you understand?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Red-haired girl. Got it. Got it, boss.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you join the others?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll follow her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. So who is looking around the room, doing something?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can we check for traps?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Make an investigation check. What are you checking for traps?

lines.name: MARY, SAM
lines.text: The floor.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: You said there was shit written on the pillar? Can I see if I recognize any of the symbols on the pillar?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. What languages do you speak?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I speak Common, Elven, Halfling, Valley Girl.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was your check, Mary?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: 18. And I speak Elvish, Abysmal and Common.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not a very used room. But on the ceiling you do notice faint symbols covered in years of cobwebs and grime. Brian, what did you roll?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Was it an investigation? 18.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. So you cannot read any writing on these-- you're investigating the pillars? You can't read any writing on them, but it's okay because there's not really any.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Do I recognize the symbols?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There are symbols of serpents carved up and down on these pillars, way nicer than they need to be, and you can see from your excellent investigation skill that the eyes of the serpents have a faint glow of magic in them. They are definitely trapped.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: We got some weird snake shit going on over here, guys. I don't want to touch it, but I would like it if one of you did.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I was bitten by a snake on the way in, so I would recommend not touching any of the snakes.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Maybe you're immune now that it bit you and you could just go touch it and press one of the eyes and maybe it won't do anything to you. I recommend trying all the eyes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It would make such a good story, though, in your book if you did it, Kingston.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh, I know, but if it goes bad, who will be around to write the book? Surely a fan such as yourself would be dedicated enough to--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Did you always write your books or did you have a ghostwriter?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh, I didn't have a ghostwriter. Are you kidding me? The pain that I went through. I was able to pull from so many different places.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Could I also do a perception check? Do I see the symbols on the ceiling?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not yet, not until you roll.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That is a 19.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They appear to be writing in Common. They appear to be numbers. Lots and lots of numbers. Also, glancing about the room you've entered now, behind this pillar back here you find something. Heads or tails?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh! Tails. Because I'm a cat!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here you go. All right, so that is something you find.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: How high is the ceiling?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The ceiling is whatever I said before: 25 foot coved ceiling. 25 feet high. And it's covered with numbers. They're all hard to make out because it's dusty.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Numbers, huh? I have a feeling we're going to have to touch one of those.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is anyone good with numbers? I'm not great with numbers.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: And I'm drunk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. From the other side of the door you hear a girl scream.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: At the end?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh balls. All right.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: That end? Oh shit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey creepy girl! Are you good with numbers?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, but I have other skills. I would like to cast Command on the dwarf. He has to make a wisdom saving throw. So roll the d20 plus three.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Are you allowed to do this? Is he allowed to do this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, he can do whatever he wants. You can also hit him over the head if you want.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not until after this spell is done.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Aw, 13? Plus three is 16. He beat it! Damn! He beat it! Spell burned!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Now you know how I felt all night, Liam Oberon.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: You know, Jayne, I couldn't help but overhear. You were talking down the hall, and these caverns echo. Did I not hear you say that you may or may not be associated with the Chained Oblivion?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Was he anywhere near me when I had that private conversation?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The caverns do carry audio. Why don't you roll a perception check? A retroactive perception check to see if you could hear that?

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: A straight roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roll high. Catch me out, because I'm terrible. That's a two.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Two! Fuck!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You heard him say, "Jayne's a mailman."

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Got to clean my ears.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But something about Jayne has been bugging you a lot. Me too, really. If we're going to be honest.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I've got my eye on you, Jayne.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So is this where you guys are standing? Where are you?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yep! That's where you put us.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I might be leaning against something, because I'm a little tipsy.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I would like to move towards the door.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yeah, I'll go with her.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So there is a door there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a door.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Then there's a girl screaming on the other side of that door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jayne places her hand on Clothesline's shoulder and says: wait. No, I didn't leave that hallway. Whenever she would have walked forward I would have said, wait.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, so she's back here? But she found an object over there. So she's definitely there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's up to you if you wanted to.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I will do what you say.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can tell her to go back or you can tell her to wait there, but she's already there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come where?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I'm at that tunnel entrance. I never entered.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, got it. So you're calling her back? Great. And Frankie?

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I'm going to stay right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're standing near it, unfortunately.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Look, I just want to be close to the action.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cool. You guys kind of get the sense that the longer you stay in here the more shit's going to start happening. Anyone want to look at the door?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I would like to look at the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, Tides of Chaos. That's better. Not really. 18. 16!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great. The door is not trapped. However, it has a lock on it. A padlock. A curiously made padlock. Where is it?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Are there numbers on the padlock?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There are numbers on the padlock, and you can definitely sense that the padlock is magically enchanted. And here it is!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What are the numbers on the padlock?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who wants to look where?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm looking at the ceiling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, you're looking at the ceiling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You said there are a lot of numbers up there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tons of numbers. 29, seven, 65, 44, ten, nine, four--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And there's nothing different about any of them?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes there are. They are all in different colors. Some are red, some are green, some are yellow, some are gold, some are orange.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can you see if there are numbers, like four numbers on the ceiling that are the same color?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What color is the lock?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The lock is a basic gray. However, the slot where you line up the correct numbers has a faint color on it. The first two are orange. The second two are green.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Okay, so I'm looking at the padlock. Because you're up at the ceiling and I'm at the door, right? Two orange, two green. What do you see up top?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: An Irish flag.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. Which numbers are orange, which numbers are green up on the ceiling?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you make a perception check? It's really grimy up there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 17 for me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You definitely get a bead on the orange numbers. Grab your pencil. There's many orange numbers. They're all across the top of the ceiling. They are six, one, eight, seven, two, one, eight, two, four, nine, two, seven, one, zero.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're a terrible person.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I use this item about this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is this item? Is it the earring? It can tell you something about a person or a creature, but not about a room.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Were those the orange numbers?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those were the orange numbers.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What are the green numbers?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Make another perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I got a 14.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can make out many of them. You get the sense that if you got closer, somehow, you could see more.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How's the bard doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The bard?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The bard!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know how he's doing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I see him staring up, as well. How are you doing, darling?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Fine. I'm wondering the endgame. I might go back upstairs. But I want to see--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you read the numbers on the ceiling?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yeah, let me try. Oh wait, I did. Oh, perception. I did investigation.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I rolled a 16 for perception.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, so fine. While Kingston is fiddling with his wingle--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 20?! You both see the green numbers very clearly through the grime, dust, and cobwebs are one, five, four, nine, eight, one, four, one, three, two, zero.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keep going.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: There are three less green numbers than there are orange, and we've got two and two on the padlock, two orange and two green. First two numbers add to six and six. Motherfucker. I was promised no math.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Promised no math.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's four pillars in the room, but I assume it's not relevant.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: There's only three, right? Is the one pillar still standing, or did it explode after hitting us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's four pillars. One of them poofed out poison.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: It was rough.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry, guys. On the other side of the door, you hear a low (snarling).

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, fuck. All right.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Did that sound like a cat to anyone else?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, that sounded like a lizard or something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the lock looks like what over there?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's like a big padlock.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Is there anything I can see on the lock? Tell me about the lock.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Make an investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's got a pressure pad on it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's what I was going to do.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can we see any of the numbers on the walls? Is there anything else on the walls?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No numbers on the walls.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: There's nothing on the floor.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How many snakes are on the pillars?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let me do the math.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: There's no numbers on the pillars, correct? Just symbols?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sam's given us a MENSA challenge, and we all die here.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We come back four years later. All right, so the numbers again? Six, one, eight--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Seven months without an episode break.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On one pillar, there's one snake. On the next, there's three. On the next, there's two. On the next, there's six.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Say that again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One, three, two, six.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: That's on the pillars? Both, or all four?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This one has one, this one has three, this one has two, this one has six.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Does the padlock have four numbers to open it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Four numbers. Two orange, two green.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: How do we try them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The numbers on the pillars are not any color, are they?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.text: Okay. Of psychic damage? And he has disadvantage on his next attack, which he already had. So great.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I'mma show these motherfuckers how to act now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, you also get your bonus action, which you can use to heal--

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: My bonus action will be to cure my beloved.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How would you like to talk to her to cure her?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I have to talk to her to cure her?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's Healing Word, you have to say a word of healing.

lines.name: BRAIN
lines.text: Oh, Cure Wounds?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cure Wounds? Okay, that is a real spell; that takes an action. It's okay, just do Healing Word, bud.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh fuck, yeah. Okay. Healing Word is--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 1d4 plus something, four, maybe?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: What the hell am I doing here? That's a two.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great, you've got two hit points; you're alive.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Sorry it's not more, but hopefully it's enough to get us maybe a date, later?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kingston just saved you. Clothesline, you are alive. It is your turn. She's prone.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm prone? What can I do, then?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can get up. It's half your movement, but you can fuck me up, still.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can get up? Then I am going to clothesline that motherfucker there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great. Roll an attack?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I haven't lost a hit point this entire game.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Natural 20! (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That certainly hits. Roll 1d4 plus four?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Come on, baby. Three plus four is seven.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Double it. 14.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, the dice are doubled.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's ten. It's ten. And you're not knocked prone.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did I take my second action surge?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. Do it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to clothesline you again! A natural 20! (cheering)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What the fuck is that? Get out of this building!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Buy this die. You can sell this die for millions.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So Clothesline turns around, delivers a right-armed clothesline to you. It hurts. She kisses her bicep, uses the other arm. Left-arm clothesline on you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Give me a four, baby, give me a four. A four!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A four!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And you're prone, motherfucker.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do the Leonidas handshake with me; that was amazing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's 22 total points of damage, and you are prone. The double clothesline.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In addition to the last attack?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, that's total. 22 total.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So what did you say right before she rolled? You had taken no hit points? Say it again out loud.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, say it, please.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No hit points, to all the hit points.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All of your hit points?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, not all.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Damn it. Wait, he gave me the 1d6--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that wouldn't be useful here, anyway. Do that on a save. Eric, it is your turn. What do you want to do?

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I mean, my knowledge of his association with Chain of Oblivion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's definitely a servant of the Chained Oblivion, whom you are sworn to kill.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: You know, it's my first time playing. But it clearly states that you raided my village, and I have sworn an oath to seek revenge on the cult, or anyone associated with the cult of the Chained Oblivion, so I would like to continue the attack on Jayne.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Only the best people are in the cult. You'd be surprised.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: And I choose to do so with my maul.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Roll for an attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, that does not hit. I'm so sorry.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Man, I just revealed my hand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hold on, let me just look at you, see if you have any extra things--

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: My ex-wife said you didn't know how to use them.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Apparently, he knew how to use other things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, you know what?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: His dwarven hammer, perhaps.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you wanted to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This salamander is like, "Look at these assholes fighting amongst themselves!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just going to suggest to you that we're late in the night; you might have used Vow of Enmity as a bonus action to give you an advantage on this attack, so you could roll again.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I did write it down and circle it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So roll again; if you do better, you hit me.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I will cast my bowels of Enmity.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've shat on the floor. It's an angry poop.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I would like to use my Imodium AD and come right in. Five again!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It was meant to be. You convinced him to use it, is the thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Blinded by your hatred of the Chained Oblivion, you can't seem to make contact with your maul, and instead you swipe to the left, hitting the old lady in the face. Killing her. Again.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Problem solved, guys.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Sorry, random newcomer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's Frank's turn. We're onto the salamander, who is going to use half his movement to attack Gryffin. Rolls an eight plus seven. 15?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus seven. Okay, so it's 12 bludgeoning damage and seven fire damage.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: The fire is halved.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know what, it doesn't matter; he's not going to grapple you. He's moving. The portal is fully open. He grabs Holly, he puts one leg in. That's as far as he can get.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's got no legs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry. It's one penis in. He walks on 100 penises. He's like a centipede-- he's like a centipene. It is Gryffin's turn.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I take out my Wand of Entanglement, and I whip it at motherfucking salamander.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know what that is. What does he do?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I entangle him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Automatically?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah, I don't know. It's fun, isn't it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's the Entangle spell.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's the Entangle spell, and I have a wand that does it--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I might have written this on your card. Hold on, let me look.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I hope so, because it's going to take me a second to find it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You still get a bonus action.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Okay, well my bonus would be-- are you allowing the cantrips as a bonus?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, man. Go for it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Ray of Frost.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep, do it.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Maybe a little dinner and some laser pointer?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, don't push it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He looks back at you and says, "Fuck you, you can't catch me," and you hit him square in the face. Roll for damage.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes, I fucking can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 1d8 cold.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: 1d8 cold. Five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do you want to kill this?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: From my hand, comes a spear that hits him square in the jaw, as he-- what did he say?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Fuck you. You can't fucking catch me!"

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And at that moment, it goes (impact). Well, you figure it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, not only does it bisect his tongue, it splits his head open all the way back to the back of his neck, protruding out the back. When it goes behind him, your cold spear-- it's a cold spear? Enters the portal and instantly melts, because it's so fucking hot in there. His head splits in half, and he falls to the side, next to a frazzled and crazed Holly, who is looking at this with open eyes; she hasn't said a word.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Holly's going to need some therapy after this.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Holly! Holly, we're here, don't worry, it's all right. Move towards me. Get away from that thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, before we move forward, I know that I'm after Gryffin. Yes. So because that is so, I would like to attack the tabaxi with my whip, now.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: He's just got a thing for your love.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: She's not doing anything to her that I think is worthy of this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 13 to hit?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 18 armor class, my friend.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fuck. Okay, I'm going to start to run. One, two, three, four, five, six. Okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, good. As the defeated salamander lies motionless on the floor, there's a brief moment of calm. You look around the room. Just moments ago, you were strangers, but at the Ass Sailor, anything is possible. The girl, Holly, finally speaks. She steps forward and says, "Thank you, "kind souls. I know not why you have rescued me, but my people will be grateful, and you will be "rewarded handsomely for your goodness. I can sense that many of you do not trust each other."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I run after Liam?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Six seconds have passed. One, two, three, four, five, six.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Please, don't leave, Clothesline. I'm not done with my speech."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Jayne's running like Tom fucking Cruise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She casts Hold Person on you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Goddamn it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm spent.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Takes a lot of concentration, yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Sam, that was amazing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's hard, dudes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That was so cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ashly, we all lived, so it's like we're all winners, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is that really what it's like, Liam? Is that what it's like?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: How many did you have left, two? I had seven.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I was 12.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I kept trying to take away those two hit points for so long!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Eric's like, "I got full strength, I got full power."

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Play neutral, that's how I play it. In any game.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What items did you find and not use? The Snuff Box of Jump?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: The Snuff Box of Jump was pretty cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, you snort coke and get Jump. You also didn't find the super weird porno book or the jug of nasty grease.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: When would I have used the Scroll of Feather Fall, though?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that was something that you guys didn't go to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I could have rolled a critical hit one time, like you did three times, I could have one-hit killed any of you. Any of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, he has this special whip that if people get weak enough, you die.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So I thought it was like a Finger of Death, I wasn't sure; it seemed to be very Fingery of Deathy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sort of. Oh, it was fingery all right.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Who was Garello?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, Garello was a.k.a. Sal the Salamander.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes! I killed Garello!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were being paid to transport this girl here to them, you don't know who was paying him.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: So it would've been bad if I had found Garello.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He would've taken the girl, and taken her back to his land to do some untold badness to her.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Man, magic did not work well tonight.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Magic, it didn't work in the first half. It worked better in the basement than it did upstairs. Once I'd figured out-- the first thing that I hit him with was frost, and that was upstairs, and I was like oh, he totally, English football (squeals). And I was like, oh, okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys, this was so much fun. I hope it was fun for you. A big silent hand for Brian Foster, Mary Elizabeth McGlynn, Ashly Burch, Liam O'Brien, and Eric Bauza.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And to Sam Riegel!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thanks, guys. I'm going to go home and sleep, and then I'll see you in the morning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you to Matthew Mercer, who does this week after week after week.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Eric, how do you feel? First time playing.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: Pretty good, I called so many of my friends that actually do play for advice, and one of them, Graham Lunam, who I said I'd call out-- because he's a huge fan, he's a Canadian, watching probably right now-- he's been texting me, saying I've been doing a good job. But I would totally come back again, but thank you for having me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, thank you for getting dressed up for the occasion.

lines.name: ERIC
lines.text: I kept the AC going in the Uber, but of course I've got to cover my Olive Garden shift.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I'd like to thank my attorney, Eric Bauza, for coming tonight to play with us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have a good night, everyone. Check us out on Tuesday for Talks Machina; we'll be talking about the game and stuff. Congrats again to CholieAmenthys for winning the thing, and-- what do I say now?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yay, you say yay, Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: [music]
